title: Associate Applied Scientist
description:
**Job ID:** 811

**Alternate Locations:** United States-New Jersey-Hoboken; United States-Georgia-Atlanta

  

Newell Brands is a leading $8.3B consumer products company with a portfolio of iconic brands such as Graco®, Coleman®, Oster®, Rubbermaid® and Sharpie®, and 25,000 talented employees around the world. Our high-performance culture, unparalleled curiosity about the world around us, and talented people fuel our success. Our culture is enabled through our core values which guide all we do and how we win as One Newell. They are Integrity, Teamwork, Passion for Winning, Ownership & Leadership.

  

The Associate Applied Scientist will play an integral role supporting a core capability for the company by leveraging large volumes of data, scientific methods, and analytics to drive performance improvement. The role will be highly visible with impact globally across all Newell business units. This role is central to the goal of rapidly increasing our capability to quickly access and analyze data for insights that enable the teams to drive improvements in business critical area’s like forecast accuracy, revenue management, consumer journey, service, etc. that will drive the macro company objectives enabling growth, cash conversion and productivity.

 **Specific Responsibilities**

* Apply advanced analytics knowledge to existing business problems to grow revenue or reduce cost
* Apply analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data across all channels
* Apply new technologies and methods in data science, data engineering, and data visualization to improve the technical capabilities of the team
* Maintain standards for writing clean, organized code to streamline workflow
* Create and maintain documentation for learning and knowledge transfer
* Formulate hypotheses and use existing data to test

 **The Candidate**


The successful candidate will have a passion for building infrastructure and driving informed business decisions through sophisticated use of data and analytics. They will conduct statistical analysis, build models, and surface insights to scale and optimize our business and customer experience. The ideal candidate will have a background in applied statistics, economics or a related quantitative field, will have strong business acumen, experience working with large data sets, and experience interacting with business partners. We seek a self-starter, eager to learn, focused on impact and results with a bias for action, and with demonstrated success in using data science to drive understanding, progression, and decision making.

 **Key Qualifications**

* Postgraduate experience in analytics field, preferably with eCommerce experience.
* Academic training in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Bioscience, or Engineering. Master’s degree or Bachelor’s degree with equivalent professional experience required.
* Strong technical background in statistics, measurement, experimentation, and modeling.
* Experience working with modern ML systems such as NLP, reinforcement learning, and neural networks.
* Experience and functional familiarity with software development best practices, code testing, and using CI/CD tools in the workflow.
* Experience using custom systems using frameworks such as PyTorch.
* Experience using the Python data science/ML stack in a collaborative development environment using version control tools (git).
* Good command of SQL.
* Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, and GCP. Experience with containerized solutions such as Docker a plus.
* Conceptual understanding of the mathematical models underlying data science methods, including the trade-offs between different solutions.
* Experience with statistical forecasting in a business environment.
* Good written and oral communication skills and the ability to use these to convey results comprehensibly to a non-technical audience.
* General interpersonal savvy.
* Ability to work with and connect with all levels of employees. Experience working in a matrix environment a plus.
* Good planning and organizational skills.
* Initiative and follow-up, including a strong bias for action.
* Strong character: ability to champion the right decision in difficult situations.
* Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and assignments


Newell Brands (NASDAQ: NWL) is a leading global consumer goods company with a strong portfolio of well-known brands, including Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Graco, Coleman, Rubbermaid Commercial Products, Yankee Candle, Paper Mate, FoodSaver, Dymo, EXPO, Elmer’s, Oster, NUK, Spontex and Campingaz. We are focused on delighting consumers by lighting up everyday moments. Newell Brands and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and comply with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

title: Reservations Manager
description:
**Reservations Manager– Hawksmoor New York:**

Hawksmoor New York opened to rave reviews in 2021 and welcomed guests into our beautiful restaurant, based in a National Historic Landmark- The United Charities Building.


We are now excited to commence a search for a Reservations Manager with experience in restaurant reservations or a similar role such as reception services, bookings management, or restaurant management. You’ll know your way around email systems as well as being a great communicator on the phone and face-to-face. Along with your natural flair for first class service and hospitality you’ll be consistent, reliable and excited to lead, develop and inspire a happy and supportive reservations team.

 **Work somewhere awesome:**


Shortly after being named the best steak restaurant in the world, we became a certified B Corp last year and ranked as one of the UK’s top 100 Best Companies to work for, for 11 years in a row. This is alongside being rated as one of the most sustainable restaurant groups in the industry and raising over £1 million for charity. We are currently in a period of ambitious growth, meaning huge progression opportunities for everyone.

  



**Key responsibilities of the role include:**  

  

* Leading the reservations team with excellent service and hospitality to the Hawksmoor standard.
* Ability to motivate, train, teach, guide and nurture the reservations team.
* Responsible for the setting up, running and breaking down of each service on reservations.
* Excellent rapport with your team and guests.
* Ability to expertly run reservations and Maitre D to ensure smooth and successful services.


  

**To be considered for the role you will have:**  

  

* Extensive experience running some of the best reservation’s teams at the top restaurant and bars in New York.
* Experience launching and opening restaurants in New York and the US.
* Comfortable and experienced with high volume businesses in terms of both covers and revenue.
* Ability to create an incredible culture and work ethic within your team.
* Good interpersonal skills and ability to work harmoniously with all departments.
* Exemplary product knowledge of food and beverage.
* Excellent leadership skills with ability to teach, coach and train your team.
* Experience with restaurant systems, reservation and event platforms and technology.
  

  

  



INDEXECINDUS

title: Warehouse Materials Handler/Forklift Operator
description:
Hermann Services, Inc. offers state-of-the-art distribution services throughout the United States, from our headquarters in New Jersey. Backed by an energy-efficient fleet of equipment, state-of-the-art facilities, and partnerships with top service providers nationwide, Hermann Services is one of the country's premier asset-based logistics providers.


We are seeking a **Warehouse Materials Handler/Forklift Operator** for our warehouse in South Brunswick, NJ.

**Responsibilities**

* Unload and load trucks
* Label products
* Place inventory into specific warehouse locations
* Pick orders
* Operate forklift
* Other duties as assigned

**Qualifications**

* Min 2 years’ experience with sit down electric forklift. Aisle master/Flexi/Bendi experience preferred
* Haz-Mat experience preferred
* Knowledge of RF gun (Scanning)
* Ability to follow detailed order instruction
* Ability to read instructions and labels in English
* Ability to follow all safety procedures and policies
* Team player
* Good attitude
* Self-starter


Pay: $17.00 - $17.50 per hour


COVID-19 considerations:  

 We supply masks, hand sanitizer, and gloves to our employees and practice social distancing at our work sites.
